segment.source: How to draw UI to the edge of the screen
segment.target: How to draw UI to the edge of the screen

segment.source: By default, applications will have borders placed at the edges of the viewport.
segment.target: By default, applications will have borders placed at the edges of the viewport.

segment.source: This is to account for the TV-safe area.
segment.target: This is to account for the TV-safe area.

segment.source: For more information, see Designing for Xbox and TV.
segment.target: For more information, see Designing for Xbox and TV.

segment.source: We recommend turning this off and drawing to the edge of the screen.
segment.target: We recommend turning this off and drawing to the edge of the screen.

segment.source: You can draw to the edge of the screen by adding the following code when your application starts:
segment.target: You can draw to the edge of the screen by adding the following code when your application starts:

segment.source: Note: C++/DirectX applications do not have to worry about this.
segment.target: Note: C++/DirectX applications do not have to worry about this.

segment.source: The system will always render your application to the edge of the screen.
segment.target: The system will always render your application to the edge of the screen.
